TopicTitle: [1.7.3] SPC-v0.19 | Spaceplane Corrections, stock part texture improvements and trim switching (8 September 17)

Articles.Content: Updated download to optimized textures, as well as merged downloads - with installation instructions for both options. Thanks for the optimization tips InsanePlumer!

> 
> Updated download to optimized textures, as well as merged downloads - with installation instructions for both options. Thanks for the optimization tips InsanePlumer!

Hi Avera9eJoe, just to let you know your link is directing to the older 0.06 download, rather than your 0.07 one.

also seeing v0.06. so unless you didn't change the name of the file, we're getting the wrong version.

Edit: Looks like it was updated, just the name of the download wasn't changed. there's texture replacer instructions in the download, and since I still have the older v0.06 download saved, I compared and the older file doesn't have those instructions.

New release! Added standard canard and swept wing. Oh and also, if you're a fan of Proot's Renaissance pack, I've been making my own slight variations on his parts. I may be posting that here if I get his permission.

Please do not take this as complaints about.

Just trying to help and explain you the correct execution of textures in DDS format.

In the version 0.08 is optimized only one texture AirplaneFins.dds, the rest do not have [MipMaps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mipmap), so they are not optimized as they should be. [(MipMaps)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mipmap)

[Link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6ioBcQsnDXDY0IzRjUxVTRiMEk/view?usp=sharing) to optimized version 0.08.

Wait... you can't do that... people have to complain instead of solving things.

I've been busy with finals ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif). I'll try and get to this soon ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

Can I make a suggestion, Mr. Avera-niney-joe, Average Joe, or Avera nine Ee Joe?

A stock color pack that corrects some of the colors to a brand-wide standard.

Jeb's Junkyard uses yellow and grey (and white, but only for tanks) (like the pipes on the LV-T series) paint. The LV-N currently has orange paint, which is the signature of Rockomax.

Rockomax Conglomerate uses orange, grey, and black. Not much must be changed, but perhaps an option to have the tops/bottoms of the Rockomax tanks painted orange (they are not actually flat tops, they have a rounded tankbuttlike shape.) The yellow pipe on the Poodle should be orange, and maybe a few other accents on the Poodle could be recolored.

Kerbodyne is sleek and white/black. I figure the tankbutts ought to be a silver or grey similarly to the stock tankbutts of the Rockomax tanks.

Probodobodyne is blue and dark grey, but I don't think there's any parts that disobey this color scheme.

Steadler is yellow and white with some small bits of dark grey. Not much disobeys this color scheme either.

This is no big deal, except on the LV-N. If anything, I wish the LV-N would be given the yellow paint instead of orange paint.

I just added an optional download for a version of the Mk1 cockpit with a redone window texture to hopefully match the other window colors. Feel free to test it out if you want. I'd love input.

Paste and replace this in TextureReplacer\Default\Squad\Parts\Command\mk1Cockpit:

[mk1Cockpit.dds (Dropbox)](https://www.dropbox.com/s/exapx8tzzcty77s/mk1Cockpit.dds?dl=0)

It also makes the cockpit look a LOT like the old version of itself in the parts menu. Maybe the colors are more in line with that one. Hm. I still like it.

Thank you kindly sir! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

**MAJOR UPDATE!!!**

I finally have been able to implement a function from the FireSpitter.dll to choose between part textures, and because of this I can continue my work. I hope you all enjoy the new options!

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!

Fancy!

Saw some other people complaining about the textures, and as it turns out, the top of the fuel tanks are mismatched with the bottom, as far as the color on the edges. The Mk2 cargo bays, though, don't appear to do this. Imgur album!
